channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The world’s richest woman just joined the $100 billion club
item.description: Walmart heiress Alice Walton is a newly-minted member of the centi-billion club.

item.title: Thursday's analyst calls: Starbucks a buy, Meta Platforms gets a price target hike
item.description: A tech giant and a major coffee chain are among the stocks being talked about on Thursday.

item.title: Ubisoft shares slump as sales of 'Star Wars Outlaws' disappoint
Vistra’s stock is up more than 200% this year. Could more gains could be ahead?
Social Security: Hiking retirement age would cut benefits, but wouldn’t save it
Elon Musk snubbed by U.K. over riot comments, report says
Adrian Cheng, member of one of Asia’s richest families, resigns as New World CEO after the Hong Kong developer posts $2.5 billion loss
item.description: His resignation adds to questions over succession at the Cheng family conglomerate, whose business also spans from jewelry to logistics.

item.title: Elon Musk lashes out at U.K. government after being snubbed from top investment summit over race riot posts
item.description: It is understood that Musk wasn't added to the list after he weighed into race riots in the U.K. over the summer.

item.title: Chinese leaders admit world’s second-largest economy faces new ‘problems,’ giving hope that more support is on the way
item.description: Beijing this week unveiled measures to boost its ailing economy and hit a 5% growth target—an objective analysts say is optimistic.

item.title: France's biggest lender says there are 'too many' European banks as UniCredit moves on Commerzbank
item.description: BNP Paribas Chief Financial Officer Lars Machenil on Thursday voiced his support for greater integration in Europe's banking sector.

item.title: Federal judge approves Norfolk Southern’s $600 million settlement for residents near fiery Ohio derailment
item.description: Roughly 55,000 claims were filed. Only 370 households and 47 businesses opted out.

item.title: China to issue $284 billion of sovereign debt this year to help revive economy, sources say
item.description: China plans to issue special sovereign bonds worth about 2 trillion yuan this year as part of a fresh fiscal stimulus, two sources told Reuters.

item.title: Hong Kong stocks lead global surge on reports of more China stimulus measures
Major global chip stocks rally on Micron's 15% surge; ASML up 4%
item.description: Micron shares rose 15% in after-hours trade in the U.S. on Wednesday, sparking a rally

item.title: Putin reveals new rules on nuclear weapons in Russia's latest warning to the West
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced that Moscow's position on when it can consider using nuclear weapons could change imminently.
